attributes.action: Stop proposed demolition of interwar residence "Cawthorn", 6 The Firs CV5 6QD
attributes.additional_details: The new owner's intentions are to demolish and replace this house with two new modern dwellings, which are out of character with the eclectic mix of high quality homes in The Firs.
attributes.background: The house is a significant building, constructed in the 1930s by local builder E. Harris & Sons. Its overall proportions and fine detailing of the brickwork, make it one of the most attractive and important houses in the whole of Earlsdon. Cawthorn deserves to be listed, restored and preserved.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local planning decisions are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:
http://www.coventry.gov.uk/petitions

If you would like to apply for the building to be listed, you can do that here:

https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/apply-for-listing/
